short_text: The Surah is so designated after the word `abasa with which it opens.
text: The Surah is so designated after the word \`abasa with which it opens.

The commentators and traditionists are unanimous about the occasion of the revelation of this Surah. According to them, once some big chiefs of Makkah were sitting in the Holy Prophet's assembly and he was earnestly engaged in trying to persuade them to accept Islam. At that very point, a blind man, named Ibn Umm Maktum, approached him to seek explanation of some point concerning Islam. The Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) disliked his interruption and ignored him. Thereupon Allah sent down this Surah. From this historical incident the period of the revelation of this Surah can be precisely determined.

In the first place, it is confirmed that Hadrat Ibn Umm Maktum was one of the earliest converts to Islam. Hafiz Ibn Hajar and Hafiz Ibn Kathir have stated that he was one of those who had accepted Islam at a very early stage at Makkah.

Secondly, some of the traditions of the Hadith which relate this incident show that he had already accepted Islam and some others show that be was inclined to accept it and had approached the Holy Prophet in search of the truth. Hadrat Aishah states that coming to the Holy Prophet he had said: "O Messenger of Allah, guide me to the straight path." (Tirmidhi, Hakim, Ibn Hibban, Ibn Jarir, Abu Ya'la. According to Hadrat Abdullah bin Abbas, he had asked the meaning of a verse of the Qur'an and said to the Holy Prophet: "O Messenger of Allah, teach me the knowledge that Allah has taught you." Ibn Jarir, Ibn Abu Hatim). These statements show that he had acknowledged the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) as a Messenger of Allah and the Quran as a Book of Allah. Contrary to this, Ibn Zaid has interpreted the words la allahu yazzakka of verse 3 to mean: la allahu yuslim : "maybe that he accepts Islam." (Ibn Jarir) And Allah's own words: "What would make you know that he might reform, or heed the admonition, and admonishing might profit him?" and "The one who comes to you running, of his own will, and fears, from him you turn away", point out that by that time he had developed in himself a deep desire to learn the truth: he had come to the Holy Prophet with the belief that he was the only source of guidance and his desire would be satisfied only through him; his apparent state also reflected that if he was given instruction, he would benefit by it.

Thirdly, the names of the people who were sitting in the Holy Prophet's assembly at that time, have been given in different traditions. In this list we find the names of \`Utbah, Shaibah, Abu Jahl, Umayyah bin Khalaf, Ubayy bin Khalaf, who were the bitterest enemies of Islam. This shows that the incident took place in the period when these chiefs were still on meeting terms with the Holy Prophet and their antagonism to Islam had not yet grown so strong as to have stopped their paying visits to him and having dialogues with him off and on. All these arguments indicate that this is one of the very earliest Surahs to be revealed at Makkah.

In view of the apparent style with which the discourse opens, one feels that in this Surah Allah has expressed His displeasure against the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) for his treating the blind man with indifference and attending to the big chiefs exclusively. But when the whole Surah is considered objectively, one finds that the displeasure, in fact, has been expressed against the disbelieving Quraish, who because of their arrogant attitude and indifference to the truth, were rejecting with contempt the message of truth being conveyed by the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace). Then, besides teaching him the correct method of preaching, the error of the method that he was adopting at the start of his mission has also been pointed out. His treating the blind man with neglect and disregard and devoting all his attention to the Quraish chiefs was not for the reason that he regarded the rich as noble and a poor blind man as contemptible, and, God forbid, there was some rudeness in his manner for which Allah reproved him. But, as a matter of fact, when a caller to Truth embarks on his mission of conveying his message to the people, he naturally wants the most influential people of society to accept his message so that his task becomes easy, for even if his invitation spreads among the poor and weak people, it cannot make much difference. Almost the same attitude had the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) also adopted in the beginning, his motive being only sincerity and a desire to promote his mission and not any idea of respect for the big people and hatred for the small people. But Allah made him realize that that was not the correct method of extending invitation to Islam, but from his mission's point of view, every man, who was a seeker after truth, was important, even if he was weak, or poor, and every man, who was heedless to the truth, was unimportant, even if he occupied a high position in society. Therefore, he should openly proclaim and convey the teachings of Islam to all and sundry, but the people who were really worthy of his attention, were those who were inclined to accept the Truth, and his sublime and noble message was too high to be presented before those haughty people who in their arrogance and vanity thought that they did not stand in need of him but rather he stood in need of them.

This is the theme of vv. 1-16. From verse 17 onward the rebuke directly turns to the disbelievers, who were repudiating the invitation of the Holy Messenger of Allah (upon whom be peace). In this, first they have been reproved for their attitude which they had adopted against their Creator, Providence and Sustainer. In the end, they have been warned of the dreadful fate that they would meet in consequence of their conduct on the Day of Resurrection.
description: The surah that opens with admonishing the Prophet and refers to him as He [who] Frowned and turned away. While the Prophet was speaking to some unbelieving nobles of Quraysh, hoping to convert them, a blind Muslim man came up to learn from him, but in his eagerness to attract the disbelievers to Islam, the Prophet frowned at him. The Prophet is then reproached and told not to concern himself with the disbelievers. It takes its name from the word “he frowned” (ʿabasa) in verse 1. The surah also deals with the condemnation of man’s ingratitude: man becomes self-satisfied and forgets his origin and his final return to God.The surah is also known as: He Made a Wry Face, He Who Frowned.

Efendi Nahi.verse 80:1: Ai (Muhammedi) u mrrol e u kthye (me fytyrë)
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:2: ngase i erdhi pranë i verbëri.
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:3: E kush të dëfton ty – ndoshta ai dëshiron të pastrohet (nga mëkatet),
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:4: ose të këshillohet, e t’i sjell dobi atij këshillimi,
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:5: e atij që ësthë i pasur (e prezentohet si i panevojshëm për të besuar)
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:7: sepse, ti nuk ke përgjegjësi, nëse ai nuk don të pastrohet (të besojë);
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:8: e atij që të vjen ty duke nxituar (për këshillim)
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:10: e ti atë nuk po e merr në konsiderim.
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:11: Mos vepro ashtu! Ato janë këshilla,
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:12: e, kush të dojë, le të mësojë
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:17: Mallkuar qoftë njeriu! Sa jomirënjohës që është ai!
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:18: Prej çkahjes e krijoi Ai (Perëndia) atë (njeriun)?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:19: Prej pikës së farës e krijoi dhe përgatiti për të çdo gjë të dobishme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:20: dhe pastaj ia lehtësoi rrugën (e lindjes),
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:21: pas kësaj, (Ai) ia caktoi vdekjen dhe bëri që të varroset,
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:22: dhe, mandej kur të dojë Ai, e ringjallë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:23: Në të vërtetë! Ai – njeriu, ende nuk i ka plotësuar ato që i ka urdhëruar Ai!
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:24: Le të shikojë njeriu në ushqimin e vet:
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:25: Ne kemi derdhur ujëra (shira) të bollshme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:26: pastaj e kemi plasaritur tokën me çarje
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:27: dhe bëjmë që nga ajo të rriten drithërat,
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:33: E, kur të arrijë zëri i madh shurdhues, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:34: në Ditën kur njeriu ikën nga vëllau i tij
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:35: dhe nga nëna e babai i tij
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:36: dhe nga bashkëshortja e fëmijët e tij;
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:37: atë Ditë, çdonjëri është i preokupuar me gjendjen e vetvetes,
Efendi Nahi.verse 80:40: kurse disa fytyra, atë Ditë, pluhërosen,

null.verse 80:1: (Peyğəmbər) qaşqabağını töküb üzünü çevirdi.
null.verse 80:2: Yanına korun (Abdullah ibn Ummi-Məktumun) gəlməsindən dolayı.
null.verse 80:3: Nə bilirsən, bəlkə də, o (səndən islama dair soruşub öyrənəcəkləri ilə) təmizlənəcəkdir!
null.verse 80:4: Yaxud öyüd dinləyəcək və bu öyüd ona fayda verəcəkdir!
null.verse 80:5: (Var dövlətinə güvənib sənin öyüd-nəsihətinə qulaq asmağa) ehtiyac hiss etməyənə (dövlətliyə) gəldikdə,
null.verse 80:6: Sən üzünü ona tərəf çevirirsən (onun sözünə qulaq asırsan).
null.verse 80:7: Onun (küfrdən) təmizlənməsindən sənə nə?!
null.verse 80:8: Yüyürə-yüyürə sənin yanına gələn
null.verse 80:11: Xeyr! (Belə yaramaz, bir daha belə etmə). Həqiqətən, bu (ayələr) bir öyüd-nəsihətdir.
null.verse 80:12: Kim istəsə, ondan öyüd alar.
null.verse 80:13: (Bu Qur'an Allah dərgahında) çox möhtərəm (mö'təbər) səhifələrdə -
null.verse 80:14: (Qədir-qiyməti) yüksək (şanı uca), tərtəmiz səhifələrdədir (Şeytan onlara toxuna bilməz).
null.verse 80:15: (O, Allahla peyğəmbərlər arasında olan) elçi mələklərin əlləri ilə (lövhi-məhfuzdan köçürülür, yaxud o, elçi mələklərə e'tibar edilmişdir).
null.verse 80:16: (O mələklər ki, Allahın yanında) çox möhtərəm, (Allaha) çox müt'idirlər.
null.verse 80:17: ?lsün (kafir) insan! O nə nankordur!
null.verse 80:18: (Bu təkəbbür onda hardandır? Allah) onu hansı şeydən yaratdı?
null.verse 80:19: (Allah onu bir qətrə dəyərsiz) nütfədən yaratdı, ona biçim verdi.
null.verse 80:20: Sonra onun üçün (ana bətnindən çıxış) yolunu asanlaşdırdı.
null.verse 80:21: Sonra onu öldürüb qəbrə qoydu.
null.verse 80:22: Sonra da istədiyi vaxt onu dirildəcəkdir.
null.verse 80:23: Xeyr, (insan Allahın) ona buyurduğunu hələ yerinə yetirməmişdir.
null.verse 80:24: İnsan hələ bir yeməyinə baxsın! (Görsün ki, ona necə ruzi verdik).
null.verse 80:25: Həqiqətən, Biz yağışı bol yağdırdıq.
null.verse 80:26: Sonra yeri gözəl yaratdıq (yaxşı yardıq),
null.verse 80:27: Belə ki, orada dən (dənli bitkilər) göyərtdik;
null.verse 80:32: (Bütün bunlar) sizin və heyvanlarınızın istifadəsi üçündür!
null.verse 80:33: Nəhayət, qulaqları kar edən (o dəhşətli səs) gələndə (İsrafil surunu çalanda);
null.verse 80:34: O gün insan qaçacaq öz qardaşından;
null.verse 80:36: Zövcəsindən və oğullarından!
null.verse 80:37: O gün onlardan hər birinin istənilən qədər işi olacaqdır! (Hər kəs öz hayında olacaq, heç kəs heç kəsin halından xəbər tutmayacaqdır).
null.verse 80:38: O gün bir çox üzlər parlayacaq,
null.verse 80:40: O gün bir çox üzlərə isə toz-torpaq qonacaq,
null.verse 80:42: Onlar (pis əməllərə uyan) kafirlər, pozğunlardır!

null.verse 80:1: On
null.verse 80:2: zato što je slijepac njemu prišao,
null.verse 80:3: A šta ti znaš - možda on želi da se očisti,
null.verse 80:4: ili pouči pa da mu pouka bude od koristi.
null.verse 80:5: Onoga koji je bogat,
null.verse 80:7: a ti nisi kriv ako on neće da vjeruje;
null.verse 80:8: a onoga koji ti žureći prilazi
null.verse 80:10: ti se na njega ne osvrćeš,
null.verse 80:11: Ne čini tako! Oni su pouka -
null.verse 80:12: pa ko hoće, poučiće se -
null.verse 80:17: Proklet neka je čovjek! Koliko je on samo nezahvalan!
null.verse 80:18: Od čega ga On stvara?
null.verse 80:19: Od kapi sjemena ga stvori i za ono što je dobro za njega pripremi,
null.verse 80:20: i Pravi put mu dostupnim učini,
null.verse 80:21: zatim mu život oduzme i učini da bude sahranjen,
null.verse 80:22: i poslije će ga, kada On bude htio, oživiti.
null.verse 80:23: Uistinu! On još nije ispunio ono što mu je On naredio!
null.verse 80:24: Neka čovjek pogleda u hranu svoju;
null.verse 80:25: Mi obilno kišu prolivamo,
null.verse 80:26: zatim zemlju pukotinama rasijecamo
null.verse 80:27: i činimo da iz nje žito izrasta
null.verse 80:32: na uživanje vama i stoci vašoj.
null.verse 80:33: A kada dođe glas zaglušujući -
null.verse 80:34: na Dan kada će čovjek od brata svoga pobjeći
null.verse 80:35: i od majke svoje i od oca svoga
null.verse 80:36: i od druge svoje i od sinova svojih -
null.verse 80:37: toga Dana će se svaki čovjek samo o sebi brinuti
null.verse 80:38: neka lica biće toga Dana blistava,
null.verse 80:40: a na nekim licima toga Dana biće prašina,
null.verse 80:42: to će nevjernici - razvratnici biti.

null.verse 80:1: তিনি ভ্রূকুঞ্চিত করলেন এবং মুখ ফিরিয়ে নিলেন।
null.verse 80:2: কারণ, তাঁর কাছে এক অন্ধ আগমন করল।
null.verse 80:3: আপনি কি জানেন, সে হয়তো পরিশুদ্ধ হত,
null.verse 80:4: অথবা উপদেশ গ্রহণ করতো এবং উপদেশ তার উপকার হত।
null.verse 80:5: পরন্তু যে বেপরোয়া,
null.verse 80:7: সে শুদ্ধ না হলে আপনার কোন দোষ নেই।
null.verse 80:8: যে আপনার কাছে দৌড়ে আসলো
null.verse 80:11: কখনও এরূপ করবেন না, এটা উপদেশবানী।
null.verse 80:12: অতএব, যে ইচ্ছা করবে, সে একে গ্রহণ করবে।
null.verse 80:17: মানুষ ধ্বংস হোক, সে কত অকৃতজ্ঞ!
null.verse 80:18: তিনি তাকে কি বস্তু থেকে সৃষ্টি করেছেন?
null.verse 80:19: শুক্র থেকে তাকে সৃষ্টি করেছেন, অতঃপর তাকে সুপরিমিত করেছেন।
null.verse 80:20: অতঃপর তার পথ সহজ করেছেন,
null.verse 80:21: অতঃপর তার মৃত্যু ঘটান ও কবরস্থ করেন তাকে।
null.verse 80:22: এরপর যখন ইচ্ছা করবেন তখন তাকে পুনরুজ্জীবিত করবেন।
null.verse 80:23: সে কখনও কৃতজ্ঞ হয়নি, তিনি তাকে যা আদেশ করেছেন, সে তা পূর্ণ করেনি।
null.verse 80:24: মানুষ তার খাদ্যের প্রতি লক্ষ্য করুক,
null.verse 80:25: আমি আশ্চর্য উপায়ে পানি বর্ষণ করেছি,
null.verse 80:26: এরপর আমি ভূমিকে বিদীর্ণ করেছি,
null.verse 80:32: তোমাদেরও তোমাদের চতুস্পদ জন্তুদের উপাকারার্থে।
null.verse 80:33: অতঃপর যেদিন কর্ণবিদারক নাদ আসবে,
null.verse 80:34: সেদিন পলায়ন করবে মানুষ তার ভ্রাতার কাছ থেকে,
null.verse 80:36: তার পত্নী ও তার সন্তানদের কাছ থেকে।
null.verse 80:37: সেদিন প্রত্যেকেরই নিজের এক চিন্তা থাকবে, যা তাকে ব্যতিব্যস্ত করে রাখবে।
null.verse 80:38: অনেক মুখমন্ডল সেদিন হবে উজ্জ্বল,
null.verse 80:40: এবং অনেক মুখমন্ডল সেদিন হবে ধুলি ধূসরিত।
null.verse 80:42: তারাই কাফের পাপিষ্ঠের দল।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:1: Той се намръщи и обърна гръб,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:2: че при него е дошъл слепецът.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:3: Но ти откъде знаеш, може да се пречисти.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:4: Или да се поучи, та да му е от полза поуката.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:7: И не е твоя грижа, че не се пречиства.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:8: А от онзи, който е дошъл при теб с упоритост
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:12: и който пожелае, той се поучава -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:17: Проклет да е човекът! Колко е неблагодарен!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:18: От какво нещо го е сътворил Той?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:19: От частица сперма Той го сътвори и осъразмери.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:21: После го умъртви и повели да бъде погребан.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:22: После, когато Той пожелае, ще го възкреси.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:23: Ала не! Не изпълни той Неговата повеля.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:27: и правим от нея да поникнат зърна
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:32: за ползване от вас и от вашия добитък.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:34: в Деня, когато мъжът избяга от брат си
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:35: и от майка си, и от баща си,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:36: и от жена си, и от децата си -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:37: всеки от тях в този Ден ще е зает с дело, което ще го поглъща.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:38: Едни лица в този Ден ще бъдат сияещи,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 80:40: а по други в този Ден ще има прах,

null.verse 80:1: 他曾皺眉，而且轉身離去，
null.verse 80:2: 因為那個盲人來到他的面前。
null.verse 80:3: 你怎能知道呢？他也許能受薰陶，
null.verse 80:4: 或聽忠告，而蒙教益。
null.verse 80:5: 至於自滿者，
null.verse 80:7: 他不受薰陶，於你何干？
null.verse 80:8: 至於殷切地來請教你，
null.verse 80:11: 絕不然！這確是一種教訓。
null.verse 80:12: 誰欲記誦它，就叫誰記誦它吧。
null.verse 80:14: 那些冊業，是被稱揚的，是被滌淨的，
null.verse 80:15: 是在許多書記的手裡的；
null.verse 80:16: 那些書記，是尊貴的，是善良的。
null.verse 80:17: 該死的人！他是何等的忘恩！
null.verse 80:18: 真主曾用什麼創造他的呢？
null.verse 80:19: 是用精液。他曾創造他，並預定他發育的程序。
null.verse 80:20: 然後，他使他的道路平易。
null.verse 80:21: 然後，他使他死，並安葬他。
null.verse 80:22: 然後，當他意欲的時候，他使他復活。
null.verse 80:23: 絕不然，他還沒有奉行他所命令他的事務。
null.verse 80:24: 教人觀察自己的食物吧！
null.verse 80:25: 我將雨水大量地傾注下來。
null.verse 80:26: 然後，我使地面奇異地裂開，
null.verse 80:32: 以供你們和你們的牲畜享受。
null.verse 80:33: 當震耳欲聾的轟聲來臨的時候，
null.verse 80:34: 在那日，各人將逃避自己的弟兄、
null.verse 80:36: 自己的妻子兒女；
null.verse 80:37: 在那日，各人將自顧不暇；
null.verse 80:38: 在那日，許多面目是光華的，
null.verse 80:40: 在那日，許多面目上，將有灰塵，
null.verse 80:42: 這等人，是不信道的，是荒淫的。

null.verse 80:1: Zakabonil se a odvrátil,
null.verse 80:2: že slepec se na něho obrátil.
null.verse 80:3: Co můžeš vědět? Snad on chtěl se očistit
null.verse 80:4: či připomenutí vyslechnout, a prospěšné mu to mohlo být.
null.verse 80:5: Však pokud o boháče jde,
null.verse 80:7: a že neočišťuje se, nic nedbáš!
null.verse 80:8: O toho však, kdo spěchá k tobě pln snahy
null.verse 80:11: Tak ne! Vždyť toto je připomenutí
null.verse 80:12: a kdokoliv chce, nechť na ně si vzpomene
null.verse 80:17: Nechť zhyne ten člověk! Ach, jak je nevděčný!
null.verse 80:18: Z čeho jej Pán jeho stvořil?
null.verse 80:19: Z kapky semene jej stvořil a osud jeho určil
null.verse 80:20: a pak cestu mu ulehčil,
null.verse 80:21: potom zemřít jej nechá a do hrobu ho vložit dá
null.verse 80:22: a posléze, až zachce se mu, z mrtvých vstát mu dá.
null.verse 80:23: Však pozor! Člověk ještě nesplnil, co Pán jeho mu poručil!
null.verse 80:24: Nechť člověk pohlédne na svou potravu
null.verse 80:25: a na to, jak spustili jsme vody záplavu
null.verse 80:26: a jak v zemi jsme dali puknout trhlinám
null.verse 80:32: v užitek vašim stádům i vám.
null.verse 80:33: A až nastane třesk ohlušující,
null.verse 80:34: v ten den prchne člověk od bratra svého,
null.verse 80:36: družky své i synů svých,
null.verse 80:37: neboť každý člověk v ten den bude mít práci sám se sebou jen.
null.verse 80:38: V ten den budou tváře zjasněné,
null.verse 80:40: v ten den budou i tváře jak prach šedivé
null.verse 80:42: - to věru budou nevěřící, ti hříšníci!

null.verse 80:1: Hij (de profeet) fronste (zijn voorhoofd) en wendde zich af.
null.verse 80:2: Omdat er een blinde man tot hem kwam.
null.verse 80:3: (Mens) wat weet gij? Misschien wilde hij zich laten louteren.
null.verse 80:4: Of hij kon om raad komen, en die raad zou hem van nut kunnen zijn.
null.verse 80:5: Maar aan hem, die onverschillig is
null.verse 80:7: Hoewel gij er niet voor aansprakelijk zijt als hij zich niet loutert.
null.verse 80:8: Maar hij die zich tot u haast,
null.verse 80:11: Neen! Voorwaar, het is een vermaning.
null.verse 80:12: Dus, wie het wil, laat hem er lering uit trekken.
null.verse 80:17: Wee de mens! Hoe ondankbaar is hij!
null.verse 80:18: Waaruit heeft Hij hem geschapen?
null.verse 80:19: Uit een kleine levenskiem schept Hij hem en stelt zijn verhoudingen vast.
null.verse 80:20: Dan effent Hij de weg voor hem,
null.verse 80:21: Dan doet Hij hem sterven en geeft hem aan het graf over,
null.verse 80:22: Dan, wanneer Hij wil, zal Hij hem weer opwekken.
null.verse 80:23: Neen, hij heeft hetgeen Hij hem gebood, niet volbracht.
null.verse 80:24: Laat nu de mens naar zijn voedsel zien;
null.verse 80:25: Hoe Wij water doen neerstromen,
null.verse 80:26: Dan de aarde splijten,
null.verse 80:29: En de olijfboom en de dadelpalm.
null.verse 80:32: Voorziening voor u en uw vee!
null.verse 80:33: Maar als de oorverdovende roep komt,
null.verse 80:34: De Dag waarop een man van zijn broeder vlucht,
null.verse 80:35: En van zijn moeder en zijn vader,
null.verse 80:36: En van zijn vrouw en zijn kinderen,
null.verse 80:37: Op die Dag zal een ieder een aangeiegenheid hebben die hem bezig zal houden.
null.verse 80:38: Op die Dag zullen sommige gezichten stralend zijn,
null.verse 80:40: En op andere gezichten zal op die Dag stof liggen.
null.verse 80:42: Dat zijn de ongelovigen, de slechten.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:2: Because the blind man came unto him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:3: What could inform thee but that he might grow (in grace)
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:4: Or take heed and so the reminder might avail him ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:5: As for him who thinketh himself independent,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:7: Yet it is not thy concern if he grow not (in grace).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:8: But as for him who cometh unto thee with earnest purpose
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:11: Nay, but verily it is an Admonishment,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:12: So let whosoever will pay heed to it,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:18: From what thing doth He create him ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:19: From a drop of seed. He createth him and proportioneth him,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:20: Then maketh the way easy for him,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:21: Then causeth him to die, and burieth him;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:22: Then, when He will, He bringeth him again to life.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:23: Nay, but (man) hath not done what He commanded him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:25: How We pour water in showers
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:26: Then split the earth in clefts
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:27: And cause the grain to grow therein
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:32: Provision for you and your cattle.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:34: On the day when a man fleeth from his brother
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:35: And his mother and his father
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:36: And his wife and his children,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:37: Every man that day will have concern enough to make him heedless (of others).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:38: On that day faces will be bright as dawn,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:40: And other faces, on that day, with dust upon them,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 80:42: Those are the disbelievers, the wicked.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:2: Because there came to him the blind man (interrupting).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:3: But what could tell thee but that perchance he might grow (in spiritual understanding)?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:4: Or that he might receive admonition, and the teaching might profit him?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:5: As to one who regards Himself as self-sufficient,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:7: Though it is no blame to thee if he grow not (in spiritual understanding).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:8: But as to him who came to thee striving earnestly,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:11: By no means (should it be so)! For it is indeed a Message of instruction:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:12: Therefore let whoso will, keep it in remembrance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:13: (It is) in Books held (greatly) in honour,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:14: Exalted (in dignity), kept pure and holy,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:17: Woe to man! What hath made him reject God;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:18: From what stuff hath He created him?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:19: From a sperm-drop: He hath created him, and then mouldeth him in due proportions;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:20: Then doth He make His path smooth for him;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:21: Then He causeth him to die, and putteth him in his grave;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:22: Then, when it is His Will, He will raise him up (again).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:23: By no means hath he fulfilled what God hath commanded him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:24: Then let man look at his food, (and how We provide it):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:25: For that We pour forth water in abundance,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:26: And We split the earth in fragments,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:30: And enclosed Gardens, dense with lofty trees,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:32: For use and convenience to you and your cattle.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:33: At length, when there comes the Deafening Noise,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:34: That Day shall a man flee from his own brother,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:35: And from his mother and his father,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:36: And from his wife and his children.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:37: Each one of them, that Day, will have enough concern (of his own) to make him indifferent to the others.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:38: Some faces that Day will be beaming,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:40: And other faces that Day will be dust-stained,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 80:42: Such will be the Rejecters of God, the doers of iniquity.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:2: that the blind man came to him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:3: And what should teach thee? Perchance he would cleanse him,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:4: or yet remember, and the Reminder profit him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:7: though it is not thy concern, if he does not cleanse himself.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:8: And he who comes to thee eagerly
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:10: to him thou payest no heed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:11: No indeed; it is a Reminder
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:17: Perish Man! How unthankful he is!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:18: Of what did He create him?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:19: Of a sperm-drop He created him, and determined him,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:20: then the way eased for him,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:21: then makes him to die, and buries him,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:22: then, when He wills, He raises him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:23: No indeed! Man has not accomplished His bidding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:25: We poured out the rains abundantly,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:26: then We split the earth in fissures
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:27: and therein made the grains to grow
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:32: an enjoyment for you and your flocks.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:33: And when the Blast shall sound,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:34: upon the day when a man shall flee from his brother,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:37: every man that day shall have business to suffice him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:38: Some faces on that day shall shine
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:40: some faces on that day shall be dusty
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 80:42: those -- they are the unbelievers, the libertines.

Muhammad Asad.verse 80:2: because the blind man approached him!
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:3: Yet for all thou didst know, [O Muhammad,] he might perhaps have grown in purity,
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:4: or have been reminded [of the truth], and helped by this reminder.
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:5: Now as for him who believes himself to be self-sufficient –
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:6: to him didst thou give thy whole attention,
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:7: although thou art not accountable for his failure to attain to purity;
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:8: but as for him who came unto thee full of eagerness
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:11: NAY, VERILY, these [messages] are but a reminder:
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:12: and so, whoever is willing may remember Him
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:13: in [the light of His] revelations blest with dignity,
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:17: [But only too often] man destroys himself: how stubbornly does he deny the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:18: [Does man ever consider] out of what substance [God] creates him?
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:19: Out of a drop of sperm He creates him, and thereupon determines his nature,
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:20: and then makes it easy for him to go through life;
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:21: and in the end He causes him to die and brings him to the grave;
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:22: and then, if it be His will, He shall raise him again to life.
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:23: Nay, but [man] has never yet fulfilled what He has enjoined upon him!
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:24: Let man, then, consider [the sources of] his food:
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:25: [how it is] that We pour down water, pouring it down abundantly;
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:26: and then We cleave the earth [with new growth], cleaving it asunder,
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:27: and thereupon We cause grain to grow out of it,
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:32: for you and for your animals to enjoy.
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:33: AND SO, when the piercing call [of resurrection] is heard
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:34: on a Day when everyone will [want to] flee from his brother,
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:35: and from his mother and father,
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:36: and from his spouse and his children:
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:37: on that Day, to every one of them will his own state be of sufficient concern.
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:38: Some faces will on that Day be bright with happiness,
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:40: And some faces will on that Day with dust be covered,
Muhammad Asad.verse 80:42: these, these will be the ones who denied the truth and were immersed in iniquity!

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:1: He (the Prophet) frowned and turned his face,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:2: because the blind man came to him!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:3: What could tell you (O prophet about the prospects of the blind man?) May be, (if you had attended him properly,) he would have attained purity,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:4: or have received the advice, and the advice would have benefited him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:5: As for the one who does not care (about faith),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:6: you are anxious to pursue him,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:7: while there is no blame on you, if he does not attain purity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:8: As regards the one who has come to you rushing eagerly,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:10: to him you pay no heed!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:11: Never! (you should never act in this way,) Indeed this (Qur’ān) is an advice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:12: So, whoever so wills may pay heed to it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:13: It is (recorded) in those scripts (of the Preserved Tablet) that are honoured,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:15: in the hands of those scribes
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:17: Damned is the man! How ungrateful he is!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:18: From which stuff did He (Allah) create him?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:19: from a drop of semen! He created him, and designed him in due proportion,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:20: then He made the way easy for him,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:21: Later, he made him die, and put him into grave,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:22: Thereafter, when He will intend, He will raise him up.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:23: No! He has not yet fulfilled what He (Allah) had commanded him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:24: So, the man should consider his food,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:26: then how nicely We split the earth,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:27: then We grew in it grain,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:30: and gardens, full of thick trees,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:32: as a benefit for you and your cattle.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:33: So when the Deafening Noise will occur,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:34: the Day when one will flee from his brother,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:35: and from his mother and father,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:36: and from his wife and sons,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:37: every one of them will be too engaged in his own affairs to care for others.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:38: Many faces, on that day, will be bright,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:40: and many faces, on that day, will be stained with dust,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 80:42: Those are the disbelievers, the nefarious.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:2: because the blind man came to him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:3: And how would you know? Perhaps he would cleanse himself,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:4: or be admonished and so the reminder might benefit him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:5: But as for the one [who thinks himself] self-sufficient,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:7: yet it is not your concern if he does not cleanse himself.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:8: But as for him who comes to you hurrying
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:10: to him you pay no heed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:11: No indeed! Truly it is a reminder,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:12: so let whoever will, remember it,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:17: Perish man! What has made him ungrateful?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:18: From what thing has He created him?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:19: From a drop of sperm did He create him then proportion him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:20: Then He made the way easy for him;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:21: then He makes him die and buries him;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:22: then, when He wills, He will raise him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:23: No indeed! He has not accomplished what He commanded him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:24: So let man consider his [source of] food
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:25: that We pour down water plenteously;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:26: then We split the earth into fissures,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:27: and cause the grains to grow therein,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:32: as sustenance for you and your flocks.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:34: the day when a man will flee from his [own] brother,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:35: and his mother and his father,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:36: and his wife and his sons,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:37: every person that day will have a matter to preoccupy him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:38: On that day some faces will be shining,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:40: And some faces on that day will be covered with dust,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 80:42: Those are the disbelievers, the profligates.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:1: A feeling of uneasiness came upon his (holy) face, and he turned aside his (radiant) face,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:2: Because a blind man approached him (who interrupted his discourse).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:3: And what do you know? Perhaps he would be purified (further owing to your attending to him),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:4: Or would accept (your) advice which would provide him benefit (more and more).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:5: But the one who disregards (the Din ,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:6: You administer greater care (for his acceptance of Islam),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:7: Whereas there is no (burden of) responsibility on you, even if he does not adopt purification (i.e., faith).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:8: And as for him who has (himself) come to you exerting (in pursuit of piousness),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:9: And he fears (his Lord) as well,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:10: But you are not focusing your attention on him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:11: (O My Esteemed Beloved!) Not so indeed! These (Verses of the Holy Qur’an) are but advice.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:12: The one who seeks may accept it (and learn by heart).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:13: (They are inscribed) on venerable and revered pages,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:15: (Have come forth) by the hands of emissaries (and scribes),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:16: Who are possessors of eminence (and) embodiments of obedience.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:17: Be cursed (the disbelieving) man! How ungrateful he is!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:18: From what stuff has Allah created him?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:19: He created him from a sperm drop, then determined his measure along with that (regarding genes and sex),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:20: Then (after structuring, developing and completing it) eased for him the passage (of delivery from the mother’s womb),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:21: Then caused him to die and (buried him) in a grave.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:22: Then whenever He wills, He will raise them up (alive again).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:23: Indeed, he (the disobedient man) did not fulfil that (obligatory due) which (Allah) had commanded him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:24: So man should look at his food (and ponder).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:25: Indeed, We pour down water in torrents.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:26: Then We split the earth and tear it asunder.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:27: We then grow from it grain,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:29: And the olive and the date palm,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:31: And (a variety of) fruits and (animals’) fodder,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:32: As provision both for you and your livestock (to live on).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:33: So, when the Deafening Blast comes,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:34: On that Day man will flee from his brother,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:35: And from his mother and his father (too),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:36: And (even) from his wife and his children.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:37: On that Day every person will be in such a (dismal) state that will make him unconcerned (with everyone else).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:38: The same Day many faces will be shining (with light).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:40: And numerous faces there will be covered with dust that Day.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:41: These (faces) will be overshadowed with darkness (as well).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 80:42: They are the people who are disbelievers (and) mischief-mongers (i.e., evildoers).

null.verse 80:1: Hän (profeetta) rypisti otsaansa ja kääntyi pois,
null.verse 80:2: koska sokea mies tuli hänen luokseen.
null.verse 80:3: Mutta mistä sinä tiedät, eikö hän olisi halunnut tehdä parannusta
null.verse 80:4: tai ottaa opetuksesta vaarin, niin että se olisi koitunut hänen hyväkseen.
null.verse 80:5: Mutta toisin menettelit rikkaan suhteen, joka ei luullut sinua tarvitsevansa;
null.verse 80:7: vaikka et ollutkaan vastuussa hänen parannuksestaan.
null.verse 80:8: Mutta hänestä, joka tulee luoksesi kovassa tuskassa
null.verse 80:11: Totisesti tämä on kehoitus;
null.verse 80:12: ottakoon tämän varteen se, joka parhaan valitsee.
null.verse 80:13: Totisesti ovat tämän kirjoittaneet arvokkaille lehdille,
null.verse 80:17: Voi ihmistä! Miten kiittämätön hän onkaan!
null.verse 80:18: Mistä on Jumala hänet luonut?
null.verse 80:19: Pienestä elinidusta! Hän on luonut hänet ja kehittänyt hänet elinvoimaiseksi
null.verse 80:20: ja sitten raivannut hänelle tien, jota on helppo käydä.
null.verse 80:21: Sitten antaa Hän hänen kuolla ja määrää leposijan
null.verse 80:22: ja aikanaan, oman päätöksensä mukaan, Hän herättää hänet kuolleista.
null.verse 80:23: Mutta ei ihminen ole noudattanut sitä, mitä Hän on käskenyt hänen tehdä.
null.verse 80:24: Ajatelkoon ihminen edes saamaansa ravintoa!
null.verse 80:25: Totisesti me lähetämme veden vuolaina virtoina,
null.verse 80:26: Me murramme hänelle maan kamaran
null.verse 80:32: elatukseksi teille ja karjallenne.
null.verse 80:33: Mutta kun pasuunan mahtava pauhu kuuluu,
null.verse 80:34: sinä päivänä, jolloin mies pakenee veljensä luota,
null.verse 80:36: vaimonsa ja poikiensa luota,
null.verse 80:37: tuona päivänä tulee jokaisen kohdalle asia, joka täyttää hänen mielensä kokonaan.
null.verse 80:38: Toisten kasvot sinä päivänä kirkastuvat,
null.verse 80:40: toisten kasvoja sinä päivänä peittää tomu
null.verse 80:42: Nämä ovat uskottomia ja väärintekijöitä.

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:1: Il a froncé les sourcils et s'est détourné
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:2: parce que l'aveugle est venu à lui.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:3: Qui te le dira ? Peut-être cet homme se purifie-t-il,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:4: ou entre-t-il dans une réflexion qui lui est profitable ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:5: Quant à celui qui est largement pourvu,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:7: peu t'importe qu'il ne se purifie pas (ne fasse pas l'aumône).
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:8: Mais celui qui vient à toi rempli de zèle
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:11: Non, vraiment ! Ceci est un rappel.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:13: Il est contenu dans des feuilles vénérées,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:17: Que l'homme périsse ! Comme il est ingrat !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:18: De quelle matière Dieu l'a-t-il créé ? :
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:19: d'une goutte de sperme. Il l'a créé et Il a fixé son destin ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:20: puis Il lui a facilité le chemin ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:21: puis Il l'a fait mourir et l'a fait mettre au tombeau ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:22: puis, quand Il le voudra, Il le fera renaître.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:23: Non, vraiment ! L'homme n'accomplit pas ce que Dieu lui ordonne.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:25: C'est Nous qui avons répandu l'eau en abondance.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:26: Puis Nous avons fendu la terre profondément
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:27: et Nous en avons fait sortir des céréales,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:32: dont vous jouissez, vous et vos troupeaux.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:33: Mais lorsque viendra le grand fracas,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:34: le Jour où l'homme fuira son frère
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:37: ce jour-là, à chaque homme suffira ce qui le concerne.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:38: Ce jour-là, il y aura des visages rayonnants, rieurs et joyeux.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:39: Et des visages, ce jour-là, seront couverts de poussière,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:40: Et des visages, ce jour-là, seront couverts de poussière,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 80:42: Ce seront ceux des mécréants, des libertins !

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:1: Il s’est renfrogné et il s’est détourné
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:2: parce que l’aveugle est venu à lui.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:3: Qui te dit : peut-être [cherche]-t-il à se purifier ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:4: ou à se rappeler en sorte que le rappel lui profite ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:5: Quant à celui qui se complaît dans sa suffisance (pour sa richesse)
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:6: tu vas avec empressement à sa rencontre.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:7: Or, que t’importe qu’il ne se purifie pas »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:8: Et quant à celui qui vient à toi avec empressement
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:11: N’agis plus ainsi ! Vraiment ceci est un rappel -
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:17: Que périsse l’homme ! Qu’il est ingrat !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:19: D’une goutte de sperme, Il le crée et détermine (son destin) :
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:20: puis Il lui facilite le chemin;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:21: puis Il lui donne la mort et le met au tombeau;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:22: puis Il le ressuscitera quand Il voudra.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:23: Eh bien non ! [L’homme] n’accomplit pas ce qu’Il lui commande.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:24: Que l’homme considère donc sa nourriture :
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:25: C’est Nous qui versons l’eau abondante,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:26: puis Nous fendons la terre par fissures
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:32: pour votre jouissance vous et vos bestiaux.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:34: le jour où l’homme s’enfuira de son frère,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:35: de sa mère, de son père,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:36: de sa compagne et de ses enfants,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:37: car chacun d’eux, ce jour-là, aura son propre cas pour l’occuper.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:38: ce jour-là, il y aura des visages rayonnants,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 80:40: De même qu’il y aura, ce jour-là, des visages couverts de poussière,

null.verse 80:1: Er runzelte die Stirn und wandte sich ab,
null.verse 80:2: Weil ein blinder Mann zu ihm kam.
null.verse 80:3: Was aber läßt dich wissen? Vielleicht wünscht er, sich zu reinigen,
null.verse 80:4: Oder er möchte der Lehre lauschen und die Lehre möchte ihm nützlich sein.
null.verse 80:5: Was den anlangt, der gleichgültig ist,
null.verse 80:7: Wiewohl du nicht verantwortlich bist, wenn er sich nicht reinigen will.
null.verse 80:8: Aber der, der in Eifer zu dir kommt,
null.verse 80:11: Nein! wahrlich, dies ist eine Ermahnung -
null.verse 80:12: So möge, wer da will, seiner acht haben -,
null.verse 80:17: Verderben auf den Menschen! Wie undankbar ist er!
null.verse 80:18: Woraus erschafft Er ihn?
null.verse 80:19: Aus einem Samentropfen! Er erschafft ihn und gestaltet ihn;
null.verse 80:20: Den Weg dann macht Er leicht für ihn,
null.verse 80:21: Dann läßt Er ihn sterben und bestimmt ihm ein Grab;
null.verse 80:22: Dann, wenn Er will, erweckt Er ihn wieder.
null.verse 80:23: Nein! er hat nicht getan, was Er ihm gebot.
null.verse 80:24: So betrachte der Mensch doch seine Nahrung:
null.verse 80:25: Wie Wir Wasser in Fülle ausgießen,
null.verse 80:26: Dann die Erde in Spalten zerteilen,
null.verse 80:27: Und Korn in ihr wachsen lassen
null.verse 80:29: Und den Ölbaum und die Dattelpalme,
null.verse 80:32: Versorgung für euch und für euer Vieh!
null.verse 80:33: Doch wenn der betäubende Ruf kommt,
null.verse 80:34: Am Tage, da der Mensch seinen Bruder flieht,
null.verse 80:35: Und seine Mutter und seinen Vater,
null.verse 80:36: Und seine Gattin und seine Söhne,
null.verse 80:37: Jedermann wird an jenem Tage Sorge genug haben, daß er (anderer) nicht achtet.
null.verse 80:38: An jenem Tage werden manche Gesichter strahlend sein,
null.verse 80:40: Und andere Gesichter, an jenem Tage, werden staubbedeckt sein,
null.verse 80:42: Das sind die Ungläubigen, die Frevler.

null.verse 80:1: Dia (Muhammad) bermuka masam dan berpaling,
null.verse 80:2: karena telah datang seorang buta kepadanya.
null.verse 80:3: Tahukah kamu barangkali ia ingin membersihkan dirinya (dari dosa).
null.verse 80:4: atau dia (ingin) mendapatkan pengajaran, lalu pengajaran itu memberi manfa’at kepadanya?
null.verse 80:5: Adapun orang yang merasa dirinya serba cukup,
null.verse 80:7: Padahal tidak ada (celaan) atasmu kalau dia tidak membersihkan diri (beriman).
null.verse 80:8: Dan adapun orang yang datang kepadamu dengan bersegera (untuk mendapatkan pengajaran),
null.verse 80:11: Sekali-kali jangan (demikian)! Sesungguhnya ajaran-ajaran Tuhan itu adalah suatu peringatan,
null.verse 80:12: maka barang siapa yang menghendaki, tentulah ia memperhatikannya,
null.verse 80:17: Binasalah manusia; alangkah amat sangat kekafirannya?
null.verse 80:18: Dari apakah Allah menciptakannya?
null.verse 80:19: Dari setetes mani, Allah menciptakannya lalu menentukannya.
null.verse 80:20: Kemudian Dia memudahkan jalannya,
null.verse 80:21: kemudian Dia mematikannya dan memasukkannya ke dalam kubur,
null.verse 80:22: kemudian bila Dia menghendaki, Dia membangkitkannya kembali.
null.verse 80:23: Sekali-kali jangan; manusia itu belum melaksanakan apa yang diperintahkan Allah kepadanya,
null.verse 80:24: maka hendaklah manusia itu memperhatikan makanannya.
null.verse 80:25: Sesungguhnya Kami benar-benar telah mencurahkan air (dari langit),
null.verse 80:26: kemudian Kami belah bumi dengan sebaik-baiknya,
null.verse 80:27: lalu Kami tumbuhkan biji-bijian di bumi itu,
null.verse 80:32: untuk kesenanganmu dan untuk binatang-binatang ternakmu.
null.verse 80:33: Dan apabila datang suara yang memekakkan (tiupan sangkakala yang kedua),
null.verse 80:34: pada hari ketika manusia lari dari saudaranya,
null.verse 80:36: dari istri dan anak-anaknya.
null.verse 80:37: Setiap orang dari mereka pada hari itu mempunyai urusan yang cukup menyibukkannya.
null.verse 80:38: Banyak muka pada hari itu berseri-seri,
null.verse 80:40: dan banyak (pula) muka pada hari itu tertutup debu,
null.verse 80:42: Mereka itulah orang-orang kafir lagi durhaka.

null.verse 80:1: Si accigliò e voltò le spalle
null.verse 80:2: quando il cieco venne da lui.
null.verse 80:3: Cosa ne puoi sapere?Forse voleva purificarsi
null.verse 80:4: o riflettere, affinché il Monito gli fosse utile.
null.verse 80:5: Quanto a colui che invece pensa di bastare a se stesso ,
null.verse 80:7: Cosa t'importa se non si purifica ?
null.verse 80:8: Quanto a colui che ti viene incontro pieno di zelo,
null.verse 80:10: di lui non ti occupi affatto!
null.verse 80:11: In verità questo è un Monito:
null.verse 80:12: se ne ricordi, dunque, chi vuole.
null.verse 80:17: Perisca l'uomo, quell'ingrato !
null.verse 80:18: Da cosa l'ha creato Allah?
null.verse 80:19: Da una goccia di sperma. Lo ha creato e ha stabilito [il suo destino] ,
null.verse 80:20: quindi gli ha reso facile la via ,
null.verse 80:21: quindi l'ha fatto morire e giacere nella tomba;
null.verse 80:22: infine lo resusciterà quando lo vorrà!
null.verse 80:23: No, non ha adempiuto a quello [Allah] gli ha comandato.
null.verse 80:24: Consideri l'uomo il suo cibo:
null.verse 80:25: siamo Noi che versiamo l'acqua in abbondanza,
null.verse 80:26: poi spacchiamo la terra in profondità
null.verse 80:32: di cui godete voi e il vostro bestiame.
null.verse 80:33: Ma quando verrà il Fragore,
null.verse 80:34: il Giorno in cui l'uomo fuggirà da suo fratello,
null.verse 80:35: da sua madre e da suo padre,
null.verse 80:36: dalla sua compagna e dai suoi figli,
null.verse 80:37: poiché ognuno di loro, in quel Giorno, avrà da pensare a se stesso,
null.verse 80:38: ci saranno in quel Giorno volti radiosi,
null.verse 80:40: E ci saranno, in quel Giorno, [anche] volti terrei
null.verse 80:42: sono i miscredenti, i peccatori.

null.verse 80:1: （ムハンマドは）眉をひそめ，顔を背けた。
null.verse 80:2: 一人の盲人がやって来（て話が中断され）たためである。
null.verse 80:3: あなたにどうして分ろうか，かれは清められるかも知れないことが。
null.verse 80:4: または訓戒を受け入れて，その教えはかれを益するかもしれないことが。
null.verse 80:5: だが何の助けもいらない者（財産家）には，
null.verse 80:7: しかもかれが自ら清めなくても，あなたに責任はない。
null.verse 80:8: だが熱心に（信仰を）求めてあなたの許に来た者で，
null.verse 80:9: 畏敬の念を抱いている者には，
null.verse 80:11: 断じてそうであるべきではない。本当にこれ（クルアーン）は訓戒である。
null.verse 80:12: だから誰でも望む者には，訓戒を念じさせなさい。
null.verse 80:13: それは（アッラーの御許にある）帳簿に記されているもの。
null.verse 80:14: 至高にして清純なもの。
null.verse 80:15: 書記たち（天使）の手で（記録されたもの）。
null.verse 80:16: 気高く敬虔な（書記たち）。
null.verse 80:17: 人間（不信心者）に災いあれ。何とかれは忘恩なことよ。
null.verse 80:18: かれはどんなものから，かれを創られるのか。
null.verse 80:19: 一滴の精液からである。かれは，かれを創り，それから五体を整えられ，
null.verse 80:20: （母の胎内からの）かれの道を容易になされ，
null.verse 80:21: やがてかれを死なせて墓場に埋め，
null.verse 80:22: それから御望みの時に，かれを甦らせる。
null.verse 80:23: いや，かれが命じられたことを，（不信仰者は）果さなかった。
null.verse 80:24: かれに，自分の食物に就いて考えさせてみるがよい。
null.verse 80:25: 本当にわれは，水（雨）を豊かに注ぎ，
null.verse 80:26: 次いで大地を裂いて切れ切れにし，
null.verse 80:27: そこに生長させるものには，穀物，
null.verse 80:29: オリーブやナツメヤシ，
null.verse 80:32: あなたがたとあなたがたの家畜のための用益である。
null.verse 80:33: やがて，（終末の）一声が高鳴り，
null.verse 80:34: 人が自分の兄弟から逃れる日，
null.verse 80:36: また自分の妻や子女から（逃れる日）。
null.verse 80:37: その日誰もかれも自分のことで手いっぱい。
null.verse 80:38: （或る者たちの）顔は，その日輝き，
null.verse 80:40: だが（或る者たちの）顔は，その日挨に塗れ，
null.verse 80:42: これらの者こそ，不信心な者，放蕩者である。

null.verse 80:1: 선지자께서 눈살을 찌푸렸고 등을 돌리셨나니
null.verse 80:2: 장님이 그분께 다가와 방해하 였기 때문이라
null.verse 80:3: 그가 스스로를 순결케 하려 하는지를 무엇이 그대로 하여금 알게 하리요
null.verse 80:4: 그가 교훈을 받고 그대의 교 훈이 그를 유익하게 할련지도 모 르니라
null.verse 80:5: 스스로 충만하다 생각하는 자 있나니
null.verse 80:7: 그가 스스로를 순결케 하지 아니한 것은 그대의 책임이 아니라
null.verse 80:8: 그러나 진실로 열망하여 그대 에게 다가오는 자와
null.verse 80:11: 결코 그래서는 안되나니 그 것이 하나님의 교훈이기 때문이라
null.verse 80:12: 그러므로 원하는 자에게 그 로 하여금 교훈을 간직하도록 하 라
null.verse 80:17: 하나님을 불신한 인간들에게저주가 있을 것이라
null.verse 80:18: 그 무엇으로 하나님은 인간 을 창조하셨느뇨
null.verse 80:19: 한방울의 정액으로 인간을창조하여 운명을 주었을 뿐이라
null.verse 80:20: 그런 후 인간이 출생하기에순탄한 길을 두었으며
null.verse 80:21: 그런 다음에는 인간을 죽게하여 무덤으로 향하도록 한 후
null.verse 80:22: 하나님은 뜻이 있을 때 인 간을 다시 부활하시니라
null.verse 80:23: 실로 인간은 하나님이 명령한 것들을 수행치 않노라
null.verse 80:24: 인간으로 하여금 그가 먹는음식을 숙고하여 보게 하라
null.verse 80:25: 실로 하나님은 흡족한 비를내리게 한 후
null.verse 80:26: 대지를 펼쳐 그곳으로 부터식물을 재배케 하여
null.verse 80:32: 이 모든 것은 인간과 가축들을 위한 것이라
null.verse 80:33: 고막이 터질듯한 소리가 들 릴 때면
null.verse 80:34: 그날 인간은 그의 형제들로 부터 도주하나니
null.verse 80:36: 그의 아내와 이이들로부터 도주하노라
null.verse 80:37: 그날 그들 각자는 타인에게 무관심하며 스스로의 일에만 열중하노라
null.verse 80:38: 그날 그들 중의 일부는 얼굴에 빛이 나며
null.verse 80:40: 일부는 그날 그들의 얼굴이 먼지로 싸여지며
null.verse 80:42: 그러함이 오만한 불신자들에게 있을 것이라

null.verse 80:1: ڕووی گرژکردو ڕووی وه‌رگێڕا (مه‌به‌ست پێغه‌مبه‌ره (صلی الله علیه وسلم) کاتێك (عبدالله ی کوڕی ام مکتوم) که ئیماندارێکی نابینابوو هات بۆ خزمه‌تی، ئه‌ویش هه‌ندێك له سه‌رانی قوره‌یشی کۆ کردبۆوه به ئومێدی هیدایه‌تیان، عبدالله وتی: ئه‌ی پێغه‌مبه‌ری خوا، خوا چی فێرکردوویت منیش فێر بکه‌، پێغه‌مبه‌ر (صلی الله علیه وسلم) پێی ناخۆش بوو که قسه‌کانی پێ ده‌بڕێت، له‌به‌رئه‌وه ڕووی گرژکرد و ڕووی وه‌رگێڕا. بۆیه سه‌ره‌تای ئه‌م سووره‌ته دابه‌زی که گله‌ییه له پێغه‌مبه‌ر (صلی الله علیه وسلم).
null.verse 80:2: له‌به‌رئه‌وه‌ی نابیناکه هات بۆ لای.
null.verse 80:3: جا تۆ چوزانیت به‌ڵکو ئه‌و هاتبێت تا دڵ و ده‌روونی خاوێن بکاته‌وه‌.
null.verse 80:4: یاخود ئامۆژگاری وه‌ربگرێت، تا ئامۆژگاریه‌که سوودی پێبگه‌یه‌نێت.
null.verse 80:5: به‌ڵام ئه‌وه‌ی که خۆی بێ نیاز نیشان ده‌دات و نایه‌وێت ڕێنموومایی وه‌ربگرێت.
null.verse 80:6: تۆ له‌گه‌ڵ ئه‌ودا کۆده‌بیته‌وه و گرنگی به‌و ده‌ده‌یت و ڕوو له‌و ده‌که‌یت.
null.verse 80:7: جا تۆ هیچ گوناهبار نابیت که ئه‌و ئیمانی نه‌وێت و پاك و پوخته‌کردنی ده‌روونی نه‌وێت.
null.verse 80:8: به‌ڵام ئه‌وه‌ی که خۆی هاتوه‌ته لات و کۆشش ده‌کات و مه‌به‌ستێتی که شاره‌زای به‌رنامه‌ی خوا ببێت...
null.verse 80:10: ئه‌وه تۆ گوێ به‌و ناده‌یت و خۆتی لێ بێ ئاگا ده‌که‌یت.
null.verse 80:11: نه‌خێر وامه‌که‌و وامه‌به‌، چونکه به‌ڕاستی ئه‌م ئایه‌تانه‌، ئه‌م سوره‌ته‌، یادخستنه‌وه و ئامۆژگاریه‌.
null.verse 80:12: جا که‌سێك بیه‌وێت ڕێنموویی وه‌رگرێت، ئه‌وه یادی ده‌کات.
null.verse 80:13: (ئه‌و قورئانه‌) له چه‌ندین لاپه‌ڕه‌ی به‌ڕێزو پیرۆزدا هه‌ڵگیراوه و له (لوح المحفوظ) وه‌رگیراوه‌.
null.verse 80:14: که به‌رزو بڵند و پاك و خاوێنن.
null.verse 80:16: که به‌ڕێزو خواناس و ملکه‌چ و فه‌رمانبه‌رداران.
null.verse 80:17: ئه‌ی ئاده‌میزاد، به‌کوشت بچیت، چه‌نده کافره‌، سپڵه‌یه‌، چه‌نده خوانه‌ناس و یاخیه‌، یاخود به‌کوشت چێت ئاده‌میزاد چی وای لێکردووه که کافر بێت؟! چ پاساوێکی هه‌یه بۆ خوانه‌ناسی و یاخی بوون.
null.verse 80:18: (بۆ بیرناکاته‌وه‌‌) خوا له‌چی دروستی کردووه‌؟!
null.verse 80:19: له نوتفه‌یه‌ك (له خاڵێکی زۆر بچووك که به چاو نابینرێت) دروستی کردووه و هه‌موو ئه‌ندامانی ده‌ر و ناوی پێ به‌خشیوه و ئه‌ندازه‌گیری وردی له دروستکردنیدا ئه‌نجام داوه‌، (کات و شوێنی له‌دایکبوونی و مردنی بۆ دیاری کردووه‌).
null.verse 80:20: له‌وه‌ودوا ژیانی بۆ ئاسان کردووه و سه‌رپشکی کردووه له په‌یڕه‌وی کردنی ڕێگه‌ی چاکه یان خراپه‌، ئیمان یان کوفر، (دوای ئه‌وه‌ی که ده‌ست نیشانی هه‌ردووکیانی بۆ کردووه و سه‌ره‌نجامی ڕوون کردۆته‌وه‌).
null.verse 80:21: له‌وه‌ودوا ده‌یمرێنێت و ده‌یخاته ناو گۆڕه‌وه‌.
null.verse 80:22: پاشان کاتێك بیه‌وێت زیندووی ده‌کاته‌وه‌.
null.verse 80:23: به‌ڕاستی، ئه‌وه‌ی که خوا فه‌رمانی پێداوه هێشتا ئاده‌میزاد به‌جێی نه‌هێناوه‌.
null.verse 80:24: ده‌با ئاده‌میزاد سه‌یری خواردنه‌که‌ی بکات و سه‌رنجی بدات و بیری لێ بکاته‌وه‌.
null.verse 80:25: بێگومان ئێمه ئاومان بۆ دابارانده‌وه‌ته خواره‌وه‌، چۆن دابارینێت.
null.verse 80:26: له‌وه‌ودوا زه‌ویمان بۆ له‌ت له‌ت به چه‌که‌ره‌ی ناسکی ڕووه‌ك.
null.verse 80:30: باخچه‌ی ده‌وره‌دراو به دارخورما یان دره‌ختی تر، یاخود باخی چڕو پڕ.
null.verse 80:31: جۆره‌ها میوه‌، هاوڕێ له‌گه‌ڵ هه‌موو ئه‌و گژو گیایانه‌ی که خواکرده و ماڵات ده‌یخوات له له‌وه‌ڕگاکاندا.
null.verse 80:32: (هه‌موو ئه‌مانه ئاماده‌مان کردووه‌) تا خۆتان و ماڵاته‌کانتان سوودی لێ وه‌ربگرن.
null.verse 80:33: جا کاتێك قیامه‌ت به‌رپا بوو به‌هۆی ده‌نگێکی به‌هێزی گوێ کپ که‌ره‌وه‌.
null.verse 80:34: ئه‌و ڕۆژه (هێنده سامناکه‌) برا له‌ده‌ست براکه‌ی هه‌ڵدێت و ڕاده‌کات و خۆی لێ ده‌شارێته‌وه‌.
null.verse 80:36: له‌ده‌ست هاوسه‌رو کوڕه‌کانی...
null.verse 80:37: له‌و ڕۆژه‌دا هه‌رکه‌سێك له‌وانه ئه‌وه‌نده سه‌رگه‌رمی کێشه‌ی خۆیه‌تی، ناتوانێت فریای که‌سی تر بکه‌وێت.
null.verse 80:38: له‌و ڕۆژه‌دا ڕووخسارانێك گه‌ش و جوان و ڕوون و شادن.
null.verse 80:39: ده‌م پێکه‌نینن، مژده و شادییان لێ ده‌دره‌وشێته‌وه‌.
null.verse 80:40: له‌و ڕۆژه‌دا ڕووخسارانێکیش هه‌ن که گژو تاڵ و تۆزاوی و په‌ست غه‌مگینن.
null.verse 80:41: دێزی و ڕه‌شی و تاریکی دایپۆشیوون.
null.verse 80:42: ئا ئه‌وانه بێ باوه‌ڕو خوانه‌ناس و تاوانبارو گوناهکاره‌کانن.

null.verse 80:1: Dia memasamkan muka dan berpaling,
null.verse 80:2: Kerana dia didatangi orang buta.
null.verse 80:3: Dan apa jalannya engkau dapat mengetahui (tujuannya, wahai Muhammad)? Barangkali dia mahu membersihkan hatinya (dengan pelajaran agama yang didapatinya daripadamu)! -
null.verse 80:4: Ataupun dia mahu mendapat peringatan, supaya peringatan itu memberi manfaat kepadanya.
null.verse 80:5: Adapun orang yang merasa keadaannya telah cukup, tidak berhajat lagi (kepada ajaran Al-Quran),
null.verse 80:7: Padahal engkau tidak bersalah kalau dia tidak mahu membersihkan dirinya (dari keingkarannya).
null.verse 80:8: Adapun orang yang segera datang kepadamu,
null.verse 80:11: Janganlah melakukan lagi yang sedemikian itu! Sebenarnya ayat-ayat Al-Quran adalah pengajaran dan peringatan (yang mencukupi).
null.verse 80:12: Maka sesiapa yang mahukan kebaikan dirinya, dapatlah dia mengambil peringatan daripadanya.
null.verse 80:13: (Ayat-ayat Suci itu tersimpan) dalam naskhah-naskhah yang dimuliakan;
null.verse 80:14: Yang tinggi darjatnya, lagi suci (dari segala gangguan);
null.verse 80:15: (Terpelihara) di tangan malaikat-malaikat yang menyalinnya dari Luh Mahfuz;
null.verse 80:17: Binasalah hendaknya manusia (yang ingkar) itu, betapa besar kekufurannya?
null.verse 80:18: (Tidakkah dia memikirkan) dari apakah dia diciptakan oleh Allah?
null.verse 80:19: Dari air mani diciptakannya, serta dilengkapkan keadaannya dengan persediaan untuk bertanggungjawab;
null.verse 80:20: Kemudian jalan (baik dan jahat), dimudahkan Tuhan kepadanya (untuk menimbang dan mengambil mana satu yang dia pilih);
null.verse 80:21: Kemudian dimatikannya, lalu diperintahkan supaya dia dikuburkan;
null.verse 80:22: Kemudian apabila Allah kehendaki dibangkitkannya (hidup semula).
null.verse 80:23: Janganlah hendaknya dia kufur ingkar lagi! Sebenarnya dia belum menunaikan apa yang diperintahkan kepadanya.
null.verse 80:24: (Kalaulah dia tidak memikirkan asal dan kesudahan dirinya), maka hendaklah manusia melihat kepada makanannya (bagaimana kami mentadbirkannya):
null.verse 80:25: Sesungguhnya kami telah mencurahkan hujan dengan curahan yang menakjubkan.
null.verse 80:26: Kemudian kami belah-belahkan bumi dengan belahan yang sesuai dengan tumbuh-tumbuhan;
null.verse 80:27: Lalu Kami tumbuhkan pada bumi biji-bijian,
null.verse 80:31: Dan berbagai buah-buahan serta bermacam-macam rumput;
null.verse 80:32: Untuk kegunaan kamu dan binatang-binatang ternak kamu.
null.verse 80:33: Kemudian (ingatlah keadaan yang berlaku) apabila datang suara jeritan yang dahsyat;
null.verse 80:34: Pada hari seseorang itu lari dari saudaranya,
null.verse 80:36: Dan isterinya serta anak-anaknya;
null.verse 80:37: Kerana tiap-tiap seorang dari mereka pada hari itu, ada perkara-perkara yang cukup untuk menjadikannya sibuk dengan hal dirinya sahaja.
null.verse 80:38: Muka (orang-orang yang beriman) pada hari itu berseri-seri,
null.verse 80:40: Dan muka (orang-orang yang ingkar) pada hari itu penuh berdebu,
null.verse 80:41: Diliputi oleh warna hitam legam dan gelap-gelita.
null.verse 80:42: Mereka itu ialah orang-orang yang kafir, yang derhaka.

null.verse 80:1: چهره در هم كشيد و روى برتافت
null.verse 80:2: از اينكه نابينايى به سراغ او آمده بود!
null.verse 80:3: تو چه مى‏دانى شايد او پاكى و تقوا پيشه كند،
null.verse 80:4: يا متذكر گردد و اين تذكر به حال او مفيد باشد!
null.verse 80:5: اما آن كس كه توانگر است،
null.verse 80:7: در حالى كه اگر او خود را پاك نسازد، چيزى بر تو نيست!
null.verse 80:8: اما كسى كه به سراغ تو مى‏آيد و كوشش مى‏كند،
null.verse 80:11: هرگز چنين نيست كه آنها مى‏پندارند; اين () تذكر و يادآورى است،
null.verse 80:12: و هر كس بخواهد از آن پند مى‏گيرد!
null.verse 80:16: والا مقام و فرمانبردار و نيكوكار!
null.verse 80:17: مرگ بر اين انسان، چقدر كافر و ناسپاس است!
null.verse 80:18: (خداوند) او را از چه چيز آفريده است؟!
null.verse 80:19: او را از نطفه ناچيزى آفريد، سپس اندازه‏گيرى كرد و موزون ساخت،
null.verse 80:20: سپس راه را براى او آسان كرد،
null.verse 80:21: بعد او را ميراند و در قبر پنهان نمود،
null.verse 80:22: سپس هرگاه بخواهد او را زنده مى‏كند!
null.verse 80:23: چنين نيست كه او مى‏پندارد; او هنوز آنچه را (خدا) فرمان داده، اطاعت نكرده است!
null.verse 80:24: انسان بايد به غذاى خويش (و آفرينش آن) بنگرد!
null.verse 80:25: ما آب فراوان از آسمان فرو ريختيم،
null.verse 80:26: سپس زمين را از هم شكافتيم،
null.verse 80:27: و در آن دانه‏هاى فراوانى رويانديم،
null.verse 80:32: تا وسيله‏اى براى بهره‏گيرى شما و چهارپايانتان باشد!
null.verse 80:33: هنگامى كه آن صداى مهيب ( صيحه رستاخيز) بيايد، (كافران در اندوه عميقى فرومى‏روند)!
null.verse 80:34: در آن روز كه انسان از برادر خود مى‏گريزد،
null.verse 80:36: و زن و فرزندانش;
null.verse 80:37: در آن روز هر كدام از آنها وضعى دارد كه او را كاملا به خود مشغول مى‏سازد!
null.verse 80:38: چهره‏هائى در آن روز گشاده و نورانى است،
null.verse 80:40: و صورتهايى در آن روز غبارآلود است،
null.verse 80:41: و دود تاريكى آنها را پوشانده است،
null.verse 80:42: آنان همان كافران فاجرند!

null.verse 80:1: Tornou-se austero e voltou as costas,
null.verse 80:2: Quando o cego foi ter com ele.
null.verse 80:3: E quem te assegura que não poderia vir a ser agraciado,
null.verse 80:4: Ou receba (admoestação) e, a lição lhe será proveitosa?
null.verse 80:5: Quanto ao opulento,
null.verse 80:7: Não tens culpa se ele não crescer (em conhecimentos espirituais).
null.verse 80:8: Porém, quem a corre a ti,
null.verse 80:11: Qual! Em verdade, (o Alcorão) é uma mensagem de advertência.
null.verse 80:12: Quem quiser, pois, que preste atenção.
null.verse 80:17: Ai do homem; quão ingrato é!
null.verse 80:18: De que Ele o criou?
null.verse 80:19: De uma gota de esperma; Ele o criou e o modelou (em seguida).
null.verse 80:20: Então, suavizou-lhe o caminho,
null.verse 80:21: Depois o fez morrer e o sepultou;
null.verse 80:22: E, por fim, quando Lhe aprouver, ressuscitá-lo-á.
null.verse 80:23: Qual! O homem ainda não cumpriu o que Ele lhe ordenou.
null.verse 80:24: Que o homem repare, pois, em seu alimento.
null.verse 80:25: Em verdade, derramamos a água em abundância,
null.verse 80:26: Depois, abrimos a terra em fendas,
null.verse 80:31: E o fruto e a forragem,
null.verse 80:32: Para o vosso uso e do vosso gado.
null.verse 80:33: Porém, quando retumbar o toque ensurdecedor,
null.verse 80:34: Nesse dia, o homem fugirá do seu irmão,
null.verse 80:35: Da sua mãe e do seu pai,
null.verse 80:36: Da sua esposa e dos seus filhos.
null.verse 80:37: Nesse dia, a cada qual bastará a preocupação consigo mesmo.
null.verse 80:38: Nesse dia, haverá rostos resplandecentes,
null.verse 80:40: E também haverá, nesse dia, rostos cobertos de pó,
null.verse 80:42: Estes serão os rostos dos incrédulos, dos depravados.

Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:1: El s-a încruntat și s-a întors,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:2: Când orbul a venit la el [ca sã-l întrebe].
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:3: Și de unde sã știi? Poate cã el a voit sã se curãțeascã
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:4: Sau a venit sã fie îndemnat și i-ar fi fost spre folos îndemnarea!
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:5: În ce-l privește pe cel care nu are nevoie,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:7: Fãrã sã-ți pese cã el nu se curãțește,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:8: Iar în ce-l privește pe cel care vine la tine cu râvnã
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:11: Dar nu! El este o îndemnare
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:12: Și cine voiește se lasã îndemnat.
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:17: Sã fie ucis omul! Cât de necredincios este el!
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:18: Din ce l-a creat pe el?
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:19: Dintr-o picãturã l-a creat și i-a hotãrât .
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:20: Apoi i-a fãcut lui drumul ușor,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:21: Apoi l-a lãsat pe el sã moarã și a orânduit sã fie pus în mormânt,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:22: Apoi, atunci când va voi, îl va învia pe el.
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:23: Dar nu! [Omul] nu împlinește ceea ce El îi poruncește...
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:24: Atunci sã cugete omul la hrana sa [ca sã vadã cum a ajuns la el]!...
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:25: Noi am vãrsat apa din belșug,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:27: Și am fãcut sã creascã pe el grâne,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:32: Spre folosul vostru și al dobitoacelor voastre.
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:33: Și când va veni nenorocirea cea mare,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:34: În Ziua aceea va fugi omul de fratele lui,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:35: De mama lui, de tatãl lui,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:36: De soața lui și de copiii lui!
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:37: În Ziua aceea, fiecare om va avea lucrul sãu care îi va fi de ajuns.
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:38: În Ziua aceea, vor fi chipuri luminoase,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:40: Și în Ziua aceea, vor fi chipuri cu colb pe ele,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 80:41: Pe care le va acoperi întunericul, -

George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:1: El s-a încruntat şi a întors spatele,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:2: când orbul a venit la el.
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:3: Ce ştii tu? Poate s-ar fi mântuit
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:4: ori şi-ar fi amintit, iar amintirea i-ar fi folosit.
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:7: fără să-ţi pese dacă se va mântui,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:8: iar pe cel care vine la tine, plin de râvnă,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:13: Ea este de pe sulurile prea cinstite,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:17: Să fie ucis omul! Cât este de tăgăduitor!
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:19: Dintr-un strop de sămânţă! L-a creat şi i-a dat o soartă;
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:21: apoi l-a lăsat să moară şi a pus să fie înmormântat;
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:22: iar când va voi, îl va scula!
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:23: Nu! Omul nu împlineşte ceea ce El îi porunceşte.
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:24: Omul, să se uite la hrana sa!
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:25: Noi am vărsat apă, şi ce vărsare!
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:26: Noi am crăpat pământul, şi ce crăpare!
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:27: Noi am făcut să răsară grâne,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:34: în ziua când omul va fugi de fratele său,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:35: de mama sa, de tatăl său,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:36: de soţia sa, de fiii săi,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:37: în Ziua aceea fiece om îşi va primi răsplata.
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 80:39: vor fi chipuri strălucitoare, surâzătoare şi bucuroase,

null.verse 80:1: (Пророк) нахмурился и отвернулся
null.verse 80:2: Оттого, что подошел к нему слепой(и речь прервал).
null.verse 80:3: Как знать тебе,Быть может, душу он свою очиститьхочет?
null.verse 80:4: И он воспримет увещания твоиИ пользу извлечет из них.
null.verse 80:5: Тому же, кто богат (и знатен),
null.verse 80:7: Хотя твоей вины не будет,Коль не очистится (его душа).
null.verse 80:8: А тем же, кто со тщанием к тебеприходит,
null.verse 80:11: Но нет!Ведь это, несомненно, назиданиеГосподне!
null.verse 80:12: И всяк, кто этого желает,Пусть в памяти его хранит.
null.verse 80:17: Пусть сгинет человек!Что же заставило его отречься?
null.verse 80:18: И из чего Господь создал его?
null.verse 80:19: Из капли спермы Он его создал,И вид придал, и соразмерил,
null.verse 80:20: И облегчил его пути земные.
null.verse 80:21: Затем Он в смерть его поверги уложил в могилу2304.
null.verse 80:22: Потом, будь Его воля,Он воскресит его опять.
null.verse 80:23: Так нет же! Человек не делает того,Что заповедано ему (Аллахом)!
null.verse 80:24: Пусть взглянет он на свою пищу.
null.verse 80:25: (Чтоб мог ее он получить),Обильно воды Мы излили
null.verse 80:26: И расщепили землю
null.verse 80:28: И виноградных лоз, и трав съедобных,
null.verse 80:32: Для пользы вам и вашему скоту.
null.verse 80:33: И вот, когда раздастся вопиющийвскрик,
null.verse 80:34: В тот ДеньПокинет человек родного брата,
null.verse 80:36: Супругу и детей, —
null.verse 80:37: У каждого из нихВ тот ДеньСвоих тревог будет сполна.
null.verse 80:38: В тот ДеньСияющими будут лица у одних,
null.verse 80:39: На них — и смех, и радость.
null.verse 80:40: Другие ж лицаВ этот ДеньПокроет пыль
null.verse 80:42: Такими будут (лица) распутникови нечестивых.

null.verse 80:1: Frunció las cejasy volvió la espalda,
null.verse 80:2: porque el ciego vino a él.
null.verse 80:3: ¿Quién sabe? Quizá quería purificarse,
null.verse 80:4: o dejarse amonestar y que la amonestación le aprovechara.
null.verse 80:5: A quien es rico
null.verse 80:7: y te tiene sin cuidado que no quiera purificarse.
null.verse 80:8: En cambio, de quien viene a ti, corriendo,
null.verse 80:11: ¡No! Es un Recuerdo,
null.verse 80:12: que recordará quien quiera,
null.verse 80:17: ¡Maldito sea el hombre! ¡Qué desagradecido es!
null.verse 80:18: ¿De qué lo ha creado Él?
null.verse 80:19: De una gota lo ha creado y determinado;
null.verse 80:20: luego, le ha facilitado el camino;
null.verse 80:21: luego, le ha hecho morir y ser sepultado;
null.verse 80:22: luego, cuando É quiera, le resucitará.
null.verse 80:23: ¡No! No ha cumplido aún lo que Él le ha ordenado.
null.verse 80:24: ¡Que mire el hombre su alimento!
null.verse 80:25: Nosotros hemos derramado el agua en abundancia;!
null.verse 80:26: luego, hendido la tierra profundamente
null.verse 80:27: y hecho crecer en ella grano,
null.verse 80:32: para disfrute vuestro y de vuestros rebaños.
null.verse 80:33: Pero, cuando venga el Estruendo,
null.verse 80:34: el día que el hombre huya de su hermano,
null.verse 80:35: de su madre y de su padre,
null.verse 80:36: de su compañera y de sus hijos varones,
null.verse 80:37: ese día, cada cual tendrá bastante consigo mismo.
null.verse 80:38: Ese día, unos rostros estarán radiantes,
null.verse 80:40: mientras que otros, ese día, tendrán polvo encima,
null.verse 80:42: ésos serán los infieles, los pecadores.

null.verse 80:1: அவர் கடுகடுத்தார், மேலும் (முகத்தைத்) திருப்பிக் கொண்டார்.
null.verse 80:2: அவரிடம் அந்த அந்தகர் வந்தபோது,
null.verse 80:3: (நபியே! உம்மிடம் வந்த அவர்) அவர் தூய்மையாகி விடக்கூடும் என்பதை நீர் அறிவீரா?
null.verse 80:4: அல்லது அவர் (உம் உபதேசத்தை) நினைவு படுத்திக்கொள்வதன் மூலம், (உம்முடைய) உபதேசம் அவருக்குப் பலனளித்திருக்கலாம்.
null.verse 80:5: (உம் உபதேசத்தின்) தேவையை எவன் அலட்சியம் செய்கிறானோ-
null.verse 80:7: ஆயினும் (இஸ்லாத்தை யேற்று) அவன் தூய்மையடையாமல் போனால், உம் மீது (அதனால் குற்றம்) இல்லை.
null.verse 80:8: ஆனால், எவர் உம்மிடம் விரைந்து வந்தாரோ,
null.verse 80:11: அவ்வாறல்ல! ஏனெனில் (இத்திருக் குர்ஆன் நினைவூட்டும்) நல்லுபதேசமாகும்.
null.verse 80:12: எனவே, எவர் விரும்புகிறாரோ அவர் அதை நினைவு கொள்வார்.
null.verse 80:16: (லவ்ஹுல் மஹ்ஃபூளிலிருந்து எழுதிய அவ்வானவர்கள்) சங்கை மிக்கவர்கள்; நல்லோர்கள்.
null.verse 80:17: (நன்றி கெட்ட மனிதன்) அழிவானாக! எவ்வளவு நன்றி மறந்தவனாக அவன் இருக்கின்றான்!
null.verse 80:18: எப்பொருளால் அவனை (அல்லாஹ்) படைத்தான்? (என்பதை அவன் சிந்தித்தானா?)
null.verse 80:19: (ஒரு துளி) இந்திரியத்திலிருந்து அவனைப் படைத்து, அவனை (அளவுப்படி) சரியாக்கினான்.
null.verse 80:20: பின் அவனுக்காக வழியை எளிதாக்கினான்.
null.verse 80:21: பின் அவனை மரிக்கச் செய்து, அவனை கப்ரில்' ஆக்குகிறான்.
null.verse 80:22: பின்னர், அவன் விரும்பும்போது அவனை (உயிர்ப்பித்து) எழுப்புவான்.
null.verse 80:23: (இவ்வாறிருந்தும் அல்லாஹ் மனிதனுக்கு) எதை ஏவினானோ அதை அவன் நிறைவேற்றுவதில்லை.
null.verse 80:24: எனவே, மனிதன் தன் உணவின் பக்கமே (அது எவ்வாறு பெறப்படுகிறது) என்பதை நோட்டமிட்டுப் பார்க்கட்டும்.
null.verse 80:25: நிச்சயமாக நாமே மழையை நன்கு பொழியச் செய்கிறோம்.
null.verse 80:26: பின், பூமியைப் பிளப்பதாகப் பிளந்து-
null.verse 80:32: (இவையெல்லாம்) உங்களுக்கும், உங்கள் கால் நடைகளுக்கும் பயனளிப்பதற்காக,
null.verse 80:33: ஆகவே, (யுக முடிவின் போது காதைச் செவிடாக்கும் பெருஞ் சப்தம் வரும் போது -
null.verse 80:34: அந்த நாளில் மனிதன் விரண்டு ஓடுவான் - தன் சகோதரனை விட்டும் -
null.verse 80:35: தன் தாயை விட்டும், தன் தந்தையை விட்டும்;
null.verse 80:36: தன் மனைவியை விட்டும், தன் மக்களை விட்டும்-
null.verse 80:37: அன்று ஒவ்வொரு மனிதனுக்கும் அவனவன் (அவல) நிலையே போதுமானதாயிருக்கும்.
null.verse 80:38: அந்நாளில் சில முகங்கள் இலங்கிக் கொண்டிருக்கும்.
null.verse 80:40: ஆனால் அந்நாளில் - (வேறு) சில முகங்கள், அவற்றின் மீது புழுதி படிந்திருக்கும்.
null.verse 80:42: அவர்கள்தாம், நிராகரித்தவர்கள,; தீயவர்கள்.

null.verse 80:1: เขา (มุฮัมมัด) ทำหน้าบึ้ง และผินหน้าไปทางอื่น
null.verse 80:2: เพราะชายตาบอดมาหาเขา
null.verse 80:3: และอะไรเล่าที่จะให้เจ้ารู้ หวังว่าเขาจะมาเพื่อซักฟอกจิตใจก็ได้
null.verse 80:4: หรือเพื่อรับคำตักเตือน เพื่อที่คำตักเตือนนั้นจะเป็นประโยชน์แก่เขา
null.verse 80:5: ส่วนผู้ที่พอเพียงแล้ว
null.verse 80:6: เจ้ากลับต้อนรับขับสู้
null.verse 80:7: และไม่ใช่หน้าที่ของเจ้า การที่เขาไม่ซักฟอก
null.verse 80:8: และส่วนผู้ที่มาหาเจ้าด้วยความพยายาม
null.verse 80:9: และเขามีความกลัวเกรง
null.verse 80:10: เจ้ากลับเมินเฉย
null.verse 80:11: มิใช่เช่นนั้น แท้จริงมันเป็นข้อเตือนใจ
null.verse 80:12: ดังนั้นผู้ใดประสงค์ก็ให้รำลึกถึงข้อเตือนใจนั้น
null.verse 80:13: ซึ่งมีอยู่ในคัมภีร์อันทรงเกียรติ
null.verse 80:14: ที่ได้รับการเทิดทูน ได้รับความบริสุทธิ์
null.verse 80:15: ด้วยมือของมลาอิกะฮ์
null.verse 80:16: ผู้ทรงเกียรติ ทรงคุณธรรม
null.verse 80:17: มนุษย์นั้นถูกสังหารเสียก็ดี เขาช่างเนรคุณเสียนี่กระไร
null.verse 80:18: จากสิ่งใดเล่าพระองค์ทรงบังเกิดเขามา ?
null.verse 80:19: จากเชื้ออสุจิหยดหนึ่งพระองค์ทรงบังเกิดเขา แล้วก็กำหนดสภาวะแก่เขา
null.verse 80:20: แล้วพระองค์ก็ทรงแผ้วทางให้สะดวกแก่เขา
null.verse 80:21: ต่อมาพระองค์ให้เขาตายไป แล้วให้เขาลงหลุม
null.verse 80:22: ครั้นเมื่อพระองค์ทรงประสงค์ ก็ทรงให้เขาฟื้นคืนชีพ
null.verse 80:23: มิใช่เช่นนั้น เขามิได้ปฏิบัติในสิ่งที่พระองค์ทรงใช้เขา
null.verse 80:24: มนุษย์จงพิจารณาดูอาหารของเขาซิ
null.verse 80:25: เราได้หลั่งน้ำฝนลงมามากมายอย่างไร
null.verse 80:26: แล้วเราได้แยกแผ่นดินออกไป
null.verse 80:27: และเราได้ให้เมล็ดพืชงอกเงยขึ้นจากในแผ่นดิน
null.verse 80:28: และองุ่นและพืชผัก
null.verse 80:29: และมะกอกและอินทผลัม
null.verse 80:30: และเรือกสวนที่หนาทึบ
null.verse 80:31: และผลไม้และทุ่งหญ้า
null.verse 80:32: ทั้งนี้เพื่อเป็นประโยชน์แก่พวกเจ้าและสัตว์เลี้ยงของพวกเจ้า
null.verse 80:33: ครั้นเมื่อเสียงกัมปนาทมาถึง
null.verse 80:34: วันที่ผู้คนจะหนีจากพี่น้องของเขา
null.verse 80:35: และจากแม่ของเขา และพ่อของเขา
null.verse 80:36: และจากภริยาของเขา และลูก ๆ ของเขา
null.verse 80:37: สำหรับแต่ละคนในหมู่พวกเขาในวันนั้น มีภาระพอตัวเขาอยู่แล้ว
null.verse 80:38: หลายใบหน้าในวันนั้นแจ่มใส
null.verse 80:39: หัวเราะดีใจร่าเริง
null.verse 80:40: และหลายใบหน้าในวันนั้นมีฝุ่นจับ
null.verse 80:41: ความหม่นหมองจะปกคลุมบนใบหน้านั้น
null.verse 80:42: ชนเหล่านั้นคือพวกปฏิเสธศรัทธาพวกประพฤติชั่ว

null.verse 80:1: Афтини буриштирди ва юз ўгирди.
null.verse 80:2: Кўзи кўр киши ҳузурига келганда.
null.verse 80:3: Қаердан биласан, эҳтимол, у покланар.
null.verse 80:4: Ёки насиҳат олар ва мавъиза унга манфаат берар.
null.verse 80:5: Аммо истиғно қилганга бўлса...
null.verse 80:7: У покланмаса, сени ҳеч ким маломат қилмас.
null.verse 80:8: Аммо ҳузурингга шошилиб келган.
null.verse 80:11: Йўқ! Албатта у(оят)лар эслатмадир.
null.verse 80:12: Ким хоҳласа уни эслайдир.
null.verse 80:17: (Кофир) инсонга лаънат бўлсин, унинг кофирлиги қандоқ шиддатли бўлди.
null.verse 80:18: Уни қайси нарсадан яратди?
null.verse 80:19: Нутфадан яратди. Уни яратди ва унни ўлчовли қилди.
null.verse 80:20: Сўнгра чиқиш йўлини осон қилди.
null.verse 80:21: Сўнгра ўлдирди ва қабрга киритди.
null.verse 80:22: Сўнгра қачон хоҳласа, уни қайта тирилтиради.
null.verse 80:23: Йўқ ундоқ эмас! У ўзига У зот қилган амрни бажармади.
null.verse 80:24: Инсон ўз таомига назар солсин.
null.verse 80:25: Албатта, Биз сувни роса қуйиб қўйдик.
null.verse 80:26: Сўнгра ерни ўзига хос ёрдик.
null.verse 80:32: Сизларга ва чорваларингизга манфаат бўлсин, деб.
null.verse 80:33: Вақтики қулоқларни кар қилувчи овоз келса.
null.verse 80:34: У кунда киши қочадир; ўз ака-укасидан.
null.verse 80:36: Ва хотини ва бола-чақасидан.
null.verse 80:37: У кунда улардан ҳар бир шахсни овора қилувчи ўз иши бор.
null.verse 80:38: У кунда порлоқ чеҳралар бор.
null.verse 80:39: Улар кулгу билан тўла, етган хушхабардан хурсанд.
null.verse 80:40: У кунда ғубор босган чеҳралар бор.
null.verse 80:42: Улар, ана ўшалар, кофирлар ва фожирлардир.
